work: Hasagot HaRaavad on Mishneh Torah, Human Dispositions

text.2_Chapter, 1_Halakhah, 0_Comment: Likewise in connubial etc. Even so in complying with the commandment of a wife's conjugal rights.* Herein are outlines of rules for voluntary conduct. Mandatory laws are given, in this instance, in the book dealing with the subject. See Women, Marriage, 14.7. C.G.
text.6_Chapter, 1_Halakhah, 0_Comment: The owner of an evil tongue etc. No, but the first mentioned, namely, the sycophant, is worse than the second, namely, the evil tongue; for the sycophant, mentioned first, is the third to be killed, since sycophancy kills three, whereas the second mentioned is but a sneak killing none but himself.* Maimonides maintains that the evil tongue rather than the sycophant kills three. C.
